714014f-a.title: Manhattan: 59th Street (East) - Madison Avenue
714014f-a.text:
(1)
21 to 3 East 59th Street, north side, west from Madison to Fifth Aves.
and showing prominently a new 2-story structure at the N.W. corner of
Madison Ave. that bears No. 21 East 59th Street, and 640 Madison Ave.
This edifice replaced the 10-story Hoffman Arms. Continuing west of
same are three 4-story structures, Nos. 19 to 15 inclusive. The Plaza
Art Building (No. 13-9) was formerly called the Monroe Building. West
of the 7-story structure (No. 7-5) that adjoins the latter,is the
Sherry Netherland Hotel which is at the N.E. corner of Fifth Ave.
and bears No. 3 (also 873 Fifth Ave.)
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A detail.of same and showing mainly Nos. 13-9 and 7-5; the first
being the Plaza Art Building.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

714013f-a.title: Manhattan: 59th Street (East) - Madison Avenue
714013f-a.text:
41 and 43 East 59th Street, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of
Madison Ave. The Tuxedo, a 4-story structure directly at the corner, is
partially seen on the extreme left.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

714015f-a.title: Manhattan: 59th Street (East) - Madison Avenue
714015f-a.text:
East 59th Street, north side, east from No. 15 (left) a point slightly
west of Madison Ave., and across same. Shown at the N.W. and N.E. cor-
Nners of the latter respectively are; a new 2-story business structure and
the 4-story Tuxedo. Further eastward is the huge Hotel Delmonico, a
towered edifice at the N.W. corner of Park Ave.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
Neg N 321

721408f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 59th Street
721408f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, east side, looking north from 59th Street, showing
Madison Avenue Methodist Episcopal Church, now (1935) occupied
by a Swedish congregation.
December 21, 1930.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
